page.title: 09Religion in Barrhead
page.content: St. John's Church is the only{Roman {Catholic}church in Barrhead. This church is relatively modern, being just over twenty years old. The church is open daily and Mass is celebrated several times on Sunday. There are five{non-Catholic }churches in Barrhead. The South, Bourock and Arthurlie are Church of Scotland and there is also the Evangelic Union and the Methodist Church. Services in these churches are on a Sunday morning, usually at 11 a.m. There are two{Gospel Halls}in Barrhead which are open for Sunday services and also for evening meetings. The Salvation Army is at present building a new citadel which is due to be opened later in 1985.
